subtitle: A beautiful way to present whole salmon as the centrepiece at a buffet.

method.text: Dissolve the aspic powder in the bowling water.
Rinse the fish thoroughly to ensure it is properly cleaned. Trim off all fins. Cut the tail into a 'V' shape, to neaten. Pat dry with kitchen paper. Place the salmon into a fish poacher or kettle.
Cover with cold water. Add the lemon slices, bay leaves, pepper corns and fresh herbs. Place the poacher over the cooker hob - if necessary, over two rings.
Bring to the boil. Cover and cook for 10-15 min. Remove from heat. Leave the fish to cool completely in the liquid.
Carefully remove salmon from the poacher. Remove all the skin, leaving the head and tail intact. Place the salmon onto a large platter. Brush with the aspic. Leave to set.
Garnish with prawns, lime slices and chervil.

title: Glazed poached salmon
